title: Sacred Valley Tour
summary: Explore the heartland of the Inca Empire on this comprehensive tour of the Sacred Valley. Visit traditional villages, impressive archaeological sites, and colorful markets while learning about Andean culture and traditions.

The Sacred Valley of the Incas was once the agricultural heartland of the Inca Empire, providing food for the entire empire. This fertile valley, carved by the Urubamba River, is dotted with traditional Andean villages, impressive archaeological sites, and vibrant markets. Our tour takes you to the most important sites including Pisaq with its impressive terraces and famous market, Ollantaytambo with its massive fortress, and Chinchero with its traditional weaving techniques. The valley's lower altitude also makes it perfect for acclimatization before visiting Machu Picchu.
physicalRequirement: Easy to Moderate - suitable for most fitness levels. Some walking on uneven terrain at archaeological sites.
bestTime: Year-round. Tuesday, Thursday, and Sunday are best for Pisaq market.
